Let FFF be a field and a∈Fa \in Fa∈F. Prove that the functor from the category of commutative FFF-algebras to Set\SetSet taking an algebra RRR to the set of invertible elements of the ring R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩R\br{X}/\gen{X^2 - a}R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩ is representable.
Solution.

Denote the class of XXX in the quotient via xxx. Note that cx+dcx + dcx+d is invertible if and only if there exist c′,d′∈Rc', d' \in Rc′,d′∈R such that

1=(cx+c)(c′x+d′)=cc′x2+(cd′+c′d)x+dd′=(cd′+c′d)x+(acc′+dd′).\begin{aligned} 1 &= \p{cx + c}\p{c'x + d'} \\ &= cc'x^2 + \p{cd' + c'd}x + dd' \\ &= \p{cd' + c'd}x + \p{acc' + dd'}. \end{aligned}1​=(cx+c)(c′x+d′)=cc′x2+(cd′+c′d)x+dd′=(cd′+c′d)x+(acc′+dd′).​

Consider the FFF-algebra A=F[Z,W,Z′,W′]/⟨Z′W+Z′W,WW′+ZZ′a−1⟩A = F\br{Z, W, Z', W'}/\gen{Z'W + Z'W, WW' + ZZ'a - 1}A=F[Z,W,Z′,W′]/⟨Z′W+Z′W,WW′+ZZ′a−1⟩. Any homomorphism φ ⁣:A→R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩\func{\phi}{A}{R\br{X}/\gen{X^2 - a}}φ:A→R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩ is uniquely determined by φ(z),φ(z′),φ(w),φ(w′)\phi\p{z}, \phi\p{z'}, \phi\p{w}, \phi\p{w'}φ(z),φ(z′),φ(w),φ(w′), and note that φ(z)x+φ(w)\phi\p{z}x + \phi\p{w}φ(z)x+φ(w) is invertible by construction. In fact, because inverses are unique, φ\phiφ is determined uniquely by φ(z),φ(w)\phi\p{z}, \phi\p{w}φ(z),φ(w).

Conversely, given an invertible cx+dcx + dcx+d with inverse c′x+d′c'x + d'c′x+d′, define f ⁣:F[Z,W,Z′,W′]→R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩\func{f}{F\br{Z, W, Z', W'}}{R\br{X}/\gen{X^2 - a}}f:F[Z,W,Z′,W′]→R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩ via (Z,W,Z′,W′)↦(c,d,c′,d′)\p{Z, W, Z', W'} \mapsto \p{c, d, c', d'}(Z,W,Z′,W′)↦(c,d,c′,d′). By construction, f(⟨Z′W+Z′W,WW′+ZZ′a−1⟩)=0f\p{\gen{Z'W + Z'W, WW' + ZZ'a - 1}} = 0f(⟨Z′W+Z′W,WW′+ZZ′a−1⟩)=0, so fff descends to a function φ ⁣:A→R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩\func{\phi}{A}{R\br{X}/\gen{X^2 - a}}φ:A→R[X]/⟨X2−a⟩.
